pullRequest.title: Allow to specify 'Revision' when updating 'init.sls' via CLI or API
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR change?
With this PR, users will be able to set the "Revision Number" when updating init.sls via CLI:
spacecmd> configchannel_updateinitsls ... -r <revision>

Or via API:
configchannel.updateInitSls(..., <revision>)

Note that this is already supported by the WebUI, so we are only adapting the CLI and API accordingly.
GUI diff
No difference.

 DONE

Documentation


No documentation needed: The API documentation, which is acessible via "Help > API" on the left menu, is automatically generated.


 DONE


Test coverage


Cucumber tests were added


 DONE


Links
Fixes: https://github.com/SUSE/spacewalk/issues/13345 (Partially)
Tracks # add downstream PR, if any

 DONE

Changelogs
If you don't need a changelog check, please mark this checkbox:

 No changelog needed

If you uncheck the checkbox after the PR is created, you will need to re-run changelog_test (see below)
Re-run a test
If you need to re-run a test, please mark the related checkbox, it will be unchecked automatically once it has re-run:

 Re-run test "changelog_test"
 Re-run test "backend_unittests_pgsql"
 Re-run test "java_pgsql_tests"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_oracle"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_pgsql"
 Re-run test "susemanager_unittests"
 Re-run test "javascript_lint"
 Re-run test "spacecmd_unittests"

beforeCommit.message:
Allow to specify 'Revision' when updating 'init.sls' via CLI or API

This is already supported by the WebUI, so we are now adapting the
CLI and API accordingly:

  (CLI) spacecmd > configchannel_updateinitsls ... -r <revision>
  (API) configchannel.updateInitSls(..., <revision>)

Fixes: https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1179566

Signed-off-by: Ricardo Marques <rimarques@suse.com>

nodes.bodyText: It would be cool to have a (Cucumber?) test to cover this.
What are the pros and cons to add this as a field in this map rather than a full new parameter?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -389,6 +389,7 @@ public ConfigChannel update(User loggedInUser, String label,
      *  #struct_begin("path info")
      *      #prop_desc("string","contents", "Contents of the init.sls file")
      *      #prop_desc("boolean","contents_enc64", "Identifies base64 encoded content(default: disabled)")
+     *      #prop_desc("int", "revision", "next revision number, auto increment for null")
